channel.title: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04
channel.description:
I recently installed Ubuntu 9.04 on my computer, and I'm getting used to it. I don't really have a clue where everything is, and how to install things.
I'm wanting to install Java and Flash player (For YouTube and Runescape/Runescape Private servers), and also possibly the Java Development Kit. I've attempted to install Java myself; it's in the directory '/usr/java/jre1.6.0_14' but it doesn't seem to work.
Could someone take me through this, and is there something like Teamviewer/Remote control that you could help me with?
Thanks, Primadude.

item.title: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

I’ve got Flash player working now, it’s just Java that I can’t get on top of.

Edit: I’ve finally installed Java now :).

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04

item.title: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

did you follow the java installation link before doing the second command? if not then do it, i’ll root out the flashe errors for you
EDIT: Flash bit http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/linux-install-flash-player-10.html

item.title: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

I get this when installing Flash player:

Error: Dependency is not satisfiable: libcurl3

And when I try:[quote=“sanga282, post:4, topic:291032”]sudo update-java-alternatives -l[/quote]

I get:

update-java-alternatives: command not found

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04

item.title: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04
item.dc:creator: @spankjava spank
item.description:
@spankjava wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:4, topic:291032”]$ sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/JavaInstallation
then
sudo update-java-alternatives -l
sudo update-java-alternatives -s [/quote]

Or this if you dont know you type this in the terminal

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04

item.title: Installing Java and Flash player on Ubuntu 9.04
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

$ sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/JavaInstallation
then
sudo update-java-alternatives -l
sudo update-java-alternatives -s

Read full topic

@primadude wrote:
